posts.title: Friend of over 20 years went ape shit and asked me to leave his house when I told him I support Trump.
posts.content:
He asked me to hang out at his house, 45 minutes away. We had some drinks and some food. I helped set up his WiFi and fixed a couple things around his house because I'm handy and apparently, he's not. When I mentioned I support Trump during a conversation he lost his mind and told me to, "stop talking!" He left to smoke weed and came back, obviously perturbed. I tried to smooth it over by explaining my reasons and he blew up again, "I don't want to talk about current events with you!!" I immediately felt completely unwelcome in his home.

Ok. I drank water and coffee for the next hour or so to sober up. It was uncomfortable to say the least. When i felt ok to drive i said, " ok, I'm gonna head out." No objections from him. I made it home and texted, "made it home safe. Thanks for a fun night." No response. A couple days later i messaged, "Merry Christmas. Sorry i didn't realize having a different opinion was grounds for ending or friendship". About 15 minutes later he sent a text wall of all the things he hates about me. A lot of it was in his own head that I never did or said. I responded with only, "I wish you all the best". Oh well. A fake friendship isn't real. Sorry it took me this long to realize it. Lesson learned.
posts.raw_content:

Ok. I drank water and coffee for the next hour or so to sober up. It was uncomfortable to say the least. When i felt ok to drive i said, " ok, I'm gonna head out."  No objections from him. I made it home and texted, "made it home safe. Thanks for a fun night."

posts.title: My wife and I went out to Christmas Eve dinner this evening.
posts.content: We went to a very busy Brazilian restaurant behind enemy lines in Hyannis Massachusetts tonight. Seated behind us were two guys who were effeminate, with one seated next to a service dog. I was wearing my new Trump Santa Claus sweater I had ordered from the Mark Dice store. I noticed one of the guys was staring at me and I thought he was bothered by the sweater. When they got up to leave the one that was staring at me approached the table and asked if I was wearing the sweater because I liked Trump. I said yes I was, and he said he liked the sweater, and he was happy to see some else supported Trump like they did. He said living on the outer Cape they are surrounded by anti Trumpers and sometimes they feel alone. We exchanged Christmas greetings and I told him where to get the sweater, and they said goodbye. It was a feel good Christmas MAGA moment, except for the gay part. Merry Christmas.
